snippet: The defiant stance of the rebels’ leadership appears to be a significant setback for the government’s efforts to end ethnic and civil conflicts that have divided the country for decades.
abstract: Leaders from Myanmar's prominent rebel group Karen National Union deny a cease-fire was signed, three weeks after country announced it; defiant stance of the rebel group appears to be a significant setback for the government’s efforts to end ethnic and civil conflicts that have divided the country for decades.
lead_paragraph: The defiant stance of the rebels’ leadership appears to be a significant setback for the government’s efforts to end ethnic and civil conflicts that have divided the country for decades.

headline.main: In Myanmar, Karen Rebels Deny Signing a Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Still Defiant, Karen Rebels Deny Signing Cease-Fire With Myanmar
